title: Number of boreholes in villages per district
Education of the household per district

description: The situation in Doloow and Baidoa is very different, in Doolow people have better income, more boreholes per village, they are less unemployed and have less often no education
title: Income distribution per household

description: IDPs almost never own any land
ytitle: Acres owned by all family members
title: Acres owned per residency status

description: Those who received equipments from COOPI are more likely to have seen their productivity increasing
xtitle: Did you receive equipment from COOPI
title: Productivity increase and equipment received
Pourcentage of boys scholarized according to whether they received emergency water distribution or not

description: While for income the beneficiaries of emergency water supply are similar to the non beneficiary, in terms of pourcentage of boys going to school, this is much different. This could mean that water activities have a positive impact on scholarization. However, this should be further enquired.
title: Income of the household according to whether they received emergency water distribution or not

description: It seems that when there has been Multipurpose Water Supply System the girls go more to school. Here again, this does not mean any causality, maybe it could be the fact that this was mainly implemented in Doolow and very few in Baidoa.
title: Girls scholarization rates compared to existence of water supply system
Girls scholarization rates compared to existence of handwashing facilities.

description: It seems that when the project installed handwashing facilities the girls and boys go more to school.
title: Boys scholarization rates compared to existence of handwashing facilities.

description: However we can see that the families with the highest income also have more beneficiated from handwashing facilities. And it is among them that the scholarization rate is the highest so the causality is not established.
title: Income compared to existence of handwashing facilities.
column10: Add here a graph with a colormap of pourcentage of boys and girls going to school

description: Almost none of the boys in family where people do not use toilet go to school
title: Boys scholarization rates compared to usage of latrine the last time they defecated.

description: Among beneficiary of UCT all those who ran out of money do not have any girls at school.
title: Girls scholarization rates compared to the fact that the family has run out of UCT cash.
